intro: Plectronia paucinervia, commonly known as the slender-veined plectronia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves with few veins, giving it its scientific name. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically visited by insects. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds.
